sequence:
Shiranui, the Do-It-All Shopkeeper

<size=45>Chapter 1: Ice-Cold Shiranui</size>

scripts.say: Ever since I let Shiranui become my secretary ship, I always feel like my mental fortitude is being exercised to its limit.
Am I supposed to say "long time no see?"
What a dullard, wasting precious resources on me again...
If you wanted to be treated coldly so much, you might as well have just stood in the refrigerator, you moron.
I've waited a whole minute and you still haven't noticed that your commissions have returned. Commander, without me, you're just a washed-up lump of driftwood after all.
... these are just a few examples. On top of that, her expression - as cold and impassive as an iceberg - really makes one feel like even breathing is a mistake.
And if dealing with her at the office was hard enough, when I arrived at the store...
The next tech box will surely have something good...
Commander, if your luck is bad, you have to make up for it with quantity. Believe yourself. You can do it.
... Wait a second, this isn't the important part.
The important thing is that even in the store, where the customer is king, she still acts this way?
One really can't help but to wonder, is Shiranui only capable of making this expression?
And what's more, how did Shiranui manage to become the head of this store?
In order to solve these two mysteries, a little investigation is needed...
